abstract: Most shareholders who voted were against them, but two Citigroup directors still won re-election.
snippet: Most shareholders who voted were against them, but two Citigroup directors still won re-election.
lead_paragraph: The Citigroup  quarterly report out today indicates that two directors won re-election to the board despite the fact that more shareholders voted against them than voted for them. They won because brokers voted the shares of owners who either chose to not vote or did not get around to voting.
